body:
I am seeing below:

```
==> Installing boost
==> Fetching http://downloads.sourceforge.net/project/boost/boost/1.63.0/boost_1_63_0.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Warning: The contents of
  the archive
   look like HTML.
  The checksum will likely be bad.  If it is, you can use
  'spack clean <package>' to remove the bad archive, then
  fix your internet gateway issue and install again.
==> Error: ChecksumError: md5 checksum failed for /gpfs/homeb/pcp0/pcp0043/spack/var/spack/stage/boost-1.63.0-wwhdhaa2bb7kuijz2ezabgjguxexlbaf/boost_1_63_0.tar.bz2
    Expected 1c837ecd990bb022d07e7aab32b09847 but got cb530d737c8f2d1023797cf0587b4e05
ChecksumError: ChecksumError: md5 checksum failed for /gpfs/homeb/pcp0/pcp0043/spack/var/spack/stage/boost-1.63.0-wwhdhaa2bb7kuijz2ezabgjguxexlbaf/boost_1_63_0.tar.bz2
    Expected 1c837ecd990bb022d07e7aab32b09847 but got cb530d737c8f2d1023797cf0587b4e05
```

I can manually download from above sourceforge URL. Wonder if this is temporary sourceforge glitch.
title: Boost download from sourceforge failing?
